directions.dialogText: The best new ride at the variable amusement park is The Incrementor! However, each variable must have the right value to ride. Let's start by creating a variable called \`number\` and giving it a value of \`0\`.

levels.mission: Create a variable called \`number\` and give it a value of \`0\` to get it on the roller coaster.
levels.tools: \`number\`: a variable with a number value
levels.tips: Your code should look like this: \`var number = 0;\`

directions.dialogText: Now let's program a button that will add \`1\` to our \`number\`. Write a \`function\` called \`add1()\` and write \`number += 1;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 5, type \`function add1(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number += 1;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Now let's add another button that will increment \`number\` by \`2\`. Create a \`function\` called \`add2()\` and type \`number += 2;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 10, type \`function add2(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number += 2;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Ok! Let's add one more button. Create a \`function\` called \`add5()\` and type \`number += 5;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run your code and use the buttons to get the variable on the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 15, type \`function add5(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number += 5;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

quiz.text: Which choice below would create the variable \`fruit\` and give it a value of \`9\`?
If the variable \`brownies\` has a value of \`4\` and the variable \`cookies\` has a value of \`6\`, which choice below would have a value of \`10\`?
Which would make a variable \`doughnuts\` and give it a value of the sum of \`chocolate\` and \`sprinkles\`?
Which choice would give the variable \`number\` a value of \`12\`?

directions.dialogText: Now let's try some subtraction. We'll start by giving \`number\` a value of \`20\` so that we have a number big enough to subtract from.

levels.mission: Give \`number\` a value of \`20\` to get it on the roller coaster.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number
levels.tips: Your code should look like this: \`var number = 20;\`

directions.dialogText: Now let's program a button that will subtract \`1\` from our \`number\`. Write a \`function\` called \`subtract1()\` and write \`number -= 1;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 5, type \`function subtract1(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number -= 1;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Now let's program a button that will subtract \`2\` from our \`number\`. Write a \`function\` called \`subtract2()\` and write \`number -= 2;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 10, type \`function subtract2(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number -= 2;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: Now let's program a button that will subtract \`5\` from our \`number\`. Write a \`function\` called \`subtract5()\` and write \`number -= 5;\` between the \`{ }\`s. Run the code, then click the button until \`number\` reaches the right value to ride the roller coaster!

levels.mission: On line 15, type \`function subtract5(){}\` then, using RETURN or ENTER to create a new line between the \`{ }\`s, write \`number -= 5;\`.
levels.tools:
\`number\`: a variable with a number value

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: This is a CHALLENGE level! Fill in the \`{ }\`s for the \`subtract3()\` and \`add5()\` functions. Then use the buttons to get the varible on the ride!

levels.mission:
CHALLENGE

Fill in the \`{ }\`s for the \`subtract3()\` and \`add5()\` functions. Then use the buttons to get the varible on the ride!
levels.tools:

\`setButton(number, function)\`: sets function to button by number

directions.dialogText: This is a CHALLENGE level! Fill in the \`{ }\`s for the \`subtract3()\`, \`add4()\` and \`add10()\` functions. Then use the buttons to get the varible on the ride!

levels.mission:
CHALLENGE

Fill in the \`{ }\`s for the \`subtract3()\`,  \`add4()\` and \`add10()\` functions. Then use the buttons to get the varible on the ride!
levels.tools:

levels.tips: Don't take any wooden nickels. That's your only tip on this level! :)
